revised_title: Investigation of Quadrant Electrometers and the Role of the Guard Tube
tldr: The authors investigate the behavior of quadrant electrometers, specifically the Thomson electrometer, and discover that irregularities in the instrument's action are due to the electric action of the guard tube on the needle. They propose improvements to the design and provide a detailed analysis of the effects of the guard tube on the instrument's sensitivity and the law connecting the deflection with the potential of the needle.
